intro: Urechites dolichanthus, commonly known as the long-flowered urechites, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often covered in fine hairs. Urechites dolichanthus is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
